content.description: Very techy, bouldery and tough. Starting in the middle of the crag, climb up to and mantle onto a small ledge to reach the first bolt, then traverse the crack up and right to reach a jug and the second bolt. Climb straight up with difficulty using some small crimps and an undercling, clip the 3rd bolt mid-crux and pull a couple more hard moves to reach a rest in the underclings. A few big moves on decent holds will get you to a topout and the anchors.
content.location: In the middle of the wall, between Maple Syrup and B3 Bomber.

content.description: Bouldery route. Technical moves off the ground leading to a hands free stance. From there sustained overhanging moves. Leads to very powerful ending moves after last bolt and before anchor.
content.location: Second route from the left side of the maple wall.

content.description:
Hard for its grade with some speculation that the route is actually 12a. Clip first bolt, then a v2/3 boulder problem to good resting jug. From there go leftwards towards arete using layback and then to compression moves, v4+ boulder problem. From there mantle onto slab, run it out next bolt. Then easier climbing but with exposure to holds under roof. Do big moves, pull roof and then crux mantle.  

  Bring at least a 60m rope to lower to the ground from the anchor. You can use 50m rope also but you will have to top out and then walk down.
content.location: Walk to the far right to the maple wall, go around the corner, scramble up the small boulders. And proceed straight up over the bulge.

content.description: Climb directly below anchors for Maple Run. 6 Bolts to Cold Shut anchor. Crux is after the second bolt and continues through sustained holds for two bolts. Appears as a TR only route in Tierny's guide book but has since been bolted.
content.protection: Very well bolted. Bolts are perfectly placed.

content.description:
Start on the right facing juggy flake. Mantle on ledge and carefully walk few feet to the right. Do pumpy moves to bouldery buldge. Pull the buldge and move right and up to anchor. 

  The first route done on this wall and for a long time was the only route on this wall.
content.protection: All trad. Mostly cams to bolted anchor.
content.location: Start on left of the perfect time on a big easy right facing flake onto ledge.

content.description: Male Lesbian is a very bouldery route with three distinct cruxes separated by good rests. The start moves are the first crux as you tackle the technical bulge to get established on the wall. Move up the slab to a hard face sequence and then get ready for the big moves on good holds to finish it up. Fun, well protected, and tough.
content.protection: This is a well bolted line, 8 bolts to bolted anchor.
content.location: The route is the one next to B3 Bomber on the right. Start on the slab bulge and proceed straight up.

content.description: CLimb through a shallow overhang with flakes and cracks past two bolts. Pullover the arete and scamper up easier slabs to the pine tree anchor.
content.location: Begin about 75' right of the end of the vliff. Just to the right of a brown streak.

content.description: Three boulder problems, each separated by a good rest. However, they can be a tad run out as the name of the route refers to not having enough bolts to equip it properly. Fun nonetheless. Start right of the tree and beneath the first bolt. There are holds out right to get up to it. Continue straight up to a tricky crux at the very end. The last boulder problem is the hardest, but at least the fall is clean!
content.location: Starts just right of the flake of Maple Run, right of the tree.

content.description: The crux is within the last few moves of the route. It requires an reachy shallow underline on unsecure feet. The route starts by walking on a right angling ledge to the first bolt and then straight up into a right facing corner. You can layback the corner or skip the layback for a harder variation.
content.protection: The first bolt is high up, after that the route is well bolted.
content.location: Right of Male Lesbian, it is located in approx the center of the wall. Look for the right facing corner.

content.description:
The first wall you come to at the left end of the cliff. After extensive cleaning, several routes were bolted and established. Expect steep pumpy climbing on positive edges.

 Many of the climbs here were put up in the early 90s, with some in the 70s.
